title: Infographic: Brits Aren't Convinced About Alternative Healing
author: Anna Fleck
description: This chart shows the share of people that would opt for alternative headling methods over 'conventional' medicine.
cleaned_text: Views around medicine differ greatly around the world. As data from [Statista's Consumer Insights](https://www.statista.com/global-consumer-survey/tool/10/gcs_usa_202204?bars=1&index=0&absolute=1&missing=0&heatmap=0&rows%5B0%5D=v0110_heal_attitudeshealth&tgeditor=0) shows, a greater share of urban respondents in Vietnam (25 percent), Turkey (23 percent) and China (22 percent) would opt for alternative healing methods over conventional [medicine](https://www.statista.com/outlook/dmo/ecommerce/beauty-health-personal-household-care/health-care/worldwide) than in other countries. In Finland, for example, alternative forms of medicine are far less popular, with only 8 percent of Finns saying they would pick them if they had the choice. Of the selected countries, Brits were some of the least open to alternative medicine forms, with only one in ten saying they would choose it. The United States is a different story, however, with nearly double the share of people picking it.
